recital.text: The Stockbridge-Munsee Community is a federally-recognized Indian tribe with inherent sovereign powers and is governed by the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council pursuant to its 1937 Constitution, as amended;

The Stockbridge-Munsee Community has the authority under its Constitution and its inherent rights as a sovereign nation to adopt and amend ordinances, including an Appellate Procedure Ordinance for the Stockbridge-Munsee Court of Appeals;

The Stockbridge-Munsee Court of Appeals has recommended that the Rules of Appellate Procedure that it adopted subject to its rulemaking authority under Section 1.12 of the Tribal Court Code be codified in an ordinance;
Chapter 5-A is a new Appellate Procedure Ordinance that codifies such Rules;
that the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council hereby adopts a new Chapter 5-A, Appellate Procedure Ordinance, as part of Stockbridge-Munsee tribal law.

procedural-data.text: I, the undersigned, as Secretary of the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council, hereby certify that the Council is composed of 7 members, of whom ____, constituting a quorum, were present at a meeting duly called, noticed, and held on the ____ day of ________, 2019, that the foregoing resolution was duly adopted at such meeting by a vote of ____ for, ____against, and ____abstaining.
Shannon Holsey, President Jerilyn Johnson, Secretary
